Reviews.Title: “It's declining”
Reviews.Author: alfgomezjr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to this hotel (our fourth time) with our oldest granddaughter for only one night to surprise our youngest daughter and granddaughter who were staying here for a 4 day vacation. We were assigned room 518 with a view towards the parking lot. But who cares? The main attractions of this hotel are the pools that include a "river pool" and a "kiddie pool". These are well kept. But food at the pool bar is expensive. Since my sense of smell is not very good, I did not notice at first, that the room smelled of mildew. This room has glass windows that do not open and does not have a balcony. Rooms on this side of the hotel do not have balconies so it is impossible to "air out" the room. I checked-in while my wife and granddaughter were in the pool (they let me check-in at 1:00 pm instead of the usual 3:00 pm) and after putting away our stuff went to the pool. Later, when my wife went into the room she noticed the smell but we decided not to change rooms so we did not have the hassle of changing our stuff to another room. Bad mistake. I spent the night with a runny nose and my allergy was acting up. At night we had dinner at the local Applebee's which was very nice and more economical than eating at the hotel's El Castillo Restaurant. I say it's declining because on previous occasions the rooms we had smelled fresh and everything was very clean. In this room (518) the bed spreads were stained with what seemed like chewing gum. Also, the wool (?) blankets had little holes in them. The curtains covering the glass windows did not close properly and early morning sunshine woke us up way too early. For our breakfast we did not go to the hotel's restaurant but went to the local El Meson sandwich shop at a nearby shopping mall. We had very good breakfast for a fraction of what it would cost us at the hotel. In all, we found the hotel average and it is a pity because the pools are very good but the room we had was way below average.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad Service at "El Castillo Restaurant"”
Reviews.Author: ROMAMAYAGUEZ
Reviews.Content: My ex husband and I used to stay in this hotel and every time we visited Puerto Rico used to go almost every day to their restaurant "El Castillo Restaurant". I was born and raised in Mayaguez (now live permanently) and I do not know what happened with this restaurant !!! Yesterday, (Good Friday) my cousin's family and I decided to go to "El Castillo Restaurant" but the service and food was the worst experience you can have. First of all the person who is in charge to open the door and I guest "host" did not greet us. Then, the waiter decided where we are going to sit, he did not welcome us or asked us where we wanted to sit. So, when I told him where we prefer to sit (near the window) he made a comment about is going to be far from the buffet bar !!! ??? The incredible thing was that only a couple was eating there, and the entirely restaurant was empty (1:05 PM) with dead flowers arrangement. No wonder !!! When the waiter asked us what we want to drink (I told him I want a bottle of "Perrier" with lemon inside) and I could not believe when he suggested us to get a big bottle of water and forget to order a "Perrier", because for him that was a much better choice ! ??? When he came to get the used plates from our table (and believe me, took forever to come), he did not ask if he may removed them, so he started inmediately crossing his arms in between us while we were eating, to pick up the dirty plates ! My cousin and I were talking and this waiter decided to be part of our conversation, so he started to make comments. One of his comments was that if my cousin's son did not study hard enough, he will see him soon washing dishes in that restaurant kitchen ! As soon as another customer came with his daughter, this waiter decided to ignore us and when I asked for the check, I was ignored and had to get up to the front desk, because he was again to busy getting in the conversation with this other customer. My cousin's wife want some coffee and we were waiting 4ever for him to come to the table, while they had in the kitchen three more waiters, talking with a waitress and of course no manager around ! At that point, I got up and decided to pay my bill and forget about that "as..ole" ! What is wrong with the people who is suppose to train the employees at this hotel and where is the manager ? What is going on inside the kitchen, while the customers are waiting and waiting for service? Two out of three plates were greasy/filthy. And ... waht a small choice in the buffet bar, so so taste of the food (except for the flan that was good.) Definitely, is not now the nice restaurant used to be 2 years ago and Never Again I'll spend my money there !!! OFFENSIVE, D' WORST RESTAURANT IN PUERTO RICO, DOWN TO HILL !!!

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly the Best in the West”
Reviews.Author: rayray1948
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to spend with family.... From the second I walked in to check in I was well received and greeted by Lorena.... She found my reservation quickly oriented me well and clearly....The pool is phenomenal!!! The restaurant delicious... I recommend this resort!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find”
Reviews.Author: ergoe
Reviews.Content: This establishment did not register on my GPS. I therefore had to find my way to it by conventional means like maps, road signs and enquiry. It turned out that it is only a short distance away from PR2, but the only sign is placed in such a way that it can only be seen by those who come from the San Juan direction. We came from Ponce and therefore missed it. Enquiry got as there eventually. The first impression of the hotel is very good. The lobby is stylishly modern, registration was friendly and efficient. The room was not generous, but adequate. It showed its age by wiring along the baseboard, but it was clean, and so was the bathroom. The room did not have drapes shutting out the sunlight, which proved more of a problem for viewing the screen of my laptop than sleeping in in the morning. Meals in the restaurant were OK, but no better. I would not come here just to eat. I would not come here for the free internet access either. Although the hotel devotes a whole page of its website in applause of its technology, the actual experience is one of mediocrity. Molasses has been seen to run faster than the hotel's data stream. Forget about a video clip to finish before you have to check out. Our room looked out onto the pool system. If we were forty years younger and had brought our kids, we would have had a grand time. As it was, we just enjoyed the view. Unfortunately, that also included a view of PR2 a little further on, which meant that the room was not all that quiet, even with the single-paned windows closed. And I am sure the air conditioning in this hotel was set to near 0Â°C to make us Canucks feel at home. Good thing I brought a sweater!

Reviews.Title: “going downhill”
Reviews.Author: angelo51pr
Reviews.Content: I use to go there a lot to the casino; the dance club and stay occasionally for the weekend but I have not returned because the cuality of the dinner buffet has deteriorated, the dance club only has an extremely small dance area and its way too expensive for the poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Offensive !”
Reviews.Author: chadwickNJ
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for 30 years as I have family here.There is new management in place with changes taking place that are very detrimental to business. The plumbing needs adjustment . One can be seriously burned with the hot water. The thermostat needs to be regulated.The faucets go every which way . Some go to the right, some to the left, some inward and some outward. The halls are freezing and the rooms upon first entering are so cold, that we had to turn the air off. The open air veranda on the ground floor is now closed in with glass . It is freezing and unappealing. It used to be so beautifully tropical . The most offensive part is that the staff has been instructed NOT to serve tap water to the guests. Under No circumstances can one get tap water in the bar or restaurant. One has to buy bottled water. There is NO CHOICE! YOu want water ?? Buy it ! Does not matter that the dinner bill is $100. It gets crazier...... The owner of the hotel also owns the bottled water company ! How is that for greed ? How is that for dumb business tactics? What is the owner thinking ? This next comment is simply inexplicable. There is a buffet , a very varied buffet with many interesting offerings. Price ? For men it is $24.95. For women it is $14.95 ? have you ever heard of anything so ridiculous ? Who is advising this owner ?

Reviews.Title: “what happened to this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Charles F
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting this hotel for several years now. This year it is a totally different place, what happened? The beautiful Verandas with the outdoor Caribbean feeling was gone! Its a huge closed up frozen place now I felt as if I was locked up in a freezer. The Verandas WAS SO COLD that we had to leave because my friend kept sneezing. Why would a place be so hostile and not even serve me a glass of water at the Restaurant? Unbelievable I asked for a glass of water with my meal and I was asked if I wanted sparkling or bottled water which is $2.50, all I wanted was a small glass of tap water because I don't drink none of the above and the glass of water was DENIED! Because of new policies they can no longer serve free water which is totally STUPID how greedy can you actually be when you can't give me a glass of water but we are freezing our @#$ off at the Verandas? What happened to the old management? Is it an inexperienced mentally challenged person running this place now? I seriously recommend you change the place to what it was before or you'll be out of business very soon. And I don't even want to talk about the rooms which the safety box don't even function properly. What Happened to the live music? There is no entertainment, you can't walk around the area because it is in a secluded place. All the employees look like their souls have been sucked out. What happened? Is the money hungry Lucifer running the place now? We checked out and went to Villa Cofresi which is very small but awesome it was right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great river pool, old rooms that need remodeling...”
Reviews.Author: Adriana N
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend with my family.... kids enjoyed very much the river pool...it is actually pretty great, although extremely cold.. .could use a water heater!!... The rooms are old and deteriorated....it is not worth the cost of the room for the stay. The bed was very comfortable, but everything else needs remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “My best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: carmen c
Reviews.Content: i have a great time very friendly the front desk agent was the best Aime she is very polite patience she gave us a beautiful room with the ocean view we had the best time ever aime is the best keep it up always has a beautiful smile ......

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Would Expect!”
Reviews.Author: Olemcdon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not clean. The floors were filthy. The room smelled like mold. The sheet had a large stain on the top sheet and smelled like soiled clothes. Somebody's hair was on the bathroom counter. The A/C was never consistent. The breakfast was good but cost $15 + tax/tip.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: cmd777_11
Reviews.Content: We got one of the rooms most depressing of the hotel. It was in the basement and when we arrived and I open the curtain what I found behind the glass was a wall. We were a group of 15 and we had 5 rooms reserved since february. We were all placed on different floors and I dont see why we were not located a least in the same floor. We were 4 adults and 1 child and we were not even offered a couch for the child. It was very depressing. Then they give you a $10 voucher to play at the casino but they donot specify that it has to be used on the tables and you have to match the voucher. The swimming pool are was great, I guess thats the only reason why I didnot take my stuff and leave.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: Lamia2011
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place! Don't bring your children to this hotel, is very dirty, NASTY! The rooms,bathrooms, carpets, everything is dirty. The place smell bad and needed a lots of upgrades! I'm very disappointed because this place does not represent Puerto Rico at all! The only thing that looks OK is the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eleduard
Reviews.Content: We get there searching for a place at last minute and love it. The rooms were very nice and clean, the service was good and the pools are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Way too air conditioned, not near beach”
Reviews.Author: emmy_7
Reviews.Content: This is a resort, and not close to the many lovely beaches near Mayaguez. I wouldn't recommend it unless one had kids who wanted to swim in the pool. Its too pricey and kept freezing cold by excessive air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lily074
Reviews.Content: Great for Kids. They will love the swimming pool. Excellent breakfast buffet. They need to remodel the rooms, but other than that, hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst in the West”
Reviews.Author: Schreiber387
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to this resort with two of our friends over the weekend of the fourth. We chose this resort because there were rooms blocked off for a wedding that we were attending in Mayaguez. Upon arrival, we were immediately helped by a bellhop, and received fairly polite service at the check in desk. However, from the time we reached our room until checkout our stay was absolutely terrible. We were sharing a room with our two friends (which costs you an extra $50 per night) but the room had only two towels, and only two pillows per bed. The pillows were flat as pancakes. We opted to walk to the front desk on our way to the restaurant. We requested additional towels and 4 additional pillows. After spending two hours at the buffet (which was phenomenal Puerto Rican food, but severely overpriced) we returned to our room to find that we had not yet received our towels or pillows. Finally, around 11 p.m. we received... two towels and two pillows. The maid told us that the resort was full and they didn't have enough pillows to give us four. After falling asleep despite an extremely loud air conditioner, we woke up the next morning and went down to breakfast. Apparently, (if you're in the know) you can get tickets for free breakfast. We paid for ours, despite terrible service and a language barrier issue when we attempted to explain that we were overcharged $5 for our meal. The river pool is absolutely fantastic, but paying $5.35 per tube seems excessive, considering you are already forced to pay a $9 per day "resort" fee, not to mention $4.50 for the privilege to park in the cramped parking lot. The free towels poolside are very helpful, and the attendant was the friendliest employee we encountered our entire stay. While at the poolside bar, we ordered a round of daiquiris which apparently are $3 for virgin, and $5 with rum. Ours had no rum in them and we were charged the $5 rate. Unfortunately we did not discover this until much later, as the bar menu conveniently lacked prices. Ordering lunch at the poolside grill was tedious at best, as the cooks repeatedly gave food that we had ordered to people who had waited less time than us, simply because they were yelling at them in very rapid Spanish. Overall, I strongly suggest avoiding this resort, especially if you speak very little Spanish. Rude staff, poor quality rooms and linens, and frequent overcharging overshadow the excellent pool area.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Leck57
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for a wedding in the area with a group of friends. It's not near the beach. They tack on resort fees, bellhop fees (there were no bellhops) and $10/day maid gratuity onto the bill. It was absolutely ridiculous. The breakfast buffet was bad and overpriced. The only ok food was at Veranda, and their drink selection was minimal as it was a limited menu since it's just an outdoor lounge area, we had to get up and get our own water, at Castillo, off the of the waiters stand every time because the waiters just didn't bother with it. You can get towels at the pool (which is actually a nicely setup pool) but if you don't return them that day, you will be charged $25/towel. They also clean the pool with bleach (we saw the cleaning crews) so don't open your eyes under water unless you want to have fuzzy vision for a few days like we did. They make you wear a plastic "spring break" type band to go to the pool and it gets you nothing else. We asked them to call us a cab to go to a beach and it took an hour because they just didn't call. Everyone's shower's were terrible, and the rooms are just not very nice and in serious need of updating. I would stay in Rincon at one of the beach houses if we could do it all again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: RockyTop
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Mayaguez Resort & Casino while on business travel. Itâ€™s close to the University of Puerto Rico which was the main reason for selecting this hotel and Fodderâ€™s noted that it was the biggest hotel on the west end of the island. After reading Trip Advisor reviews of other hotels in the area, the Mayaguez Resort seemed like our best bet. It took us a long time to find the hotel since our GPS couldnâ€™t locate it and Google maps couldnâ€™t either with any accuracy. I donâ€™t recommend arriving after dark unless you want to drive around in the less interesting parts of Mayaguez wondering if sleeping in the car is a viable option. Parking is not easy at the hotel and self-park is $4.50/day. The hotel looks like a 50â€™s vintage establishment thatâ€™s been renovated over the years. Our room had been updated with new window curtains, bedspread, shower curtains, etc., but Iâ€™ve seen cotton gauze that had more thread count then the sheets â€“ they were terrible. The comfort of the bed was okay and the carpet could stand to be replaced. As with many older hotels, watch out in the shower for flashes of very hot water sporadically and the only electrical outlet in the bathroom was on the wall with the hair dryer plugged into one of the two outlets which wasnâ€™t conducive to charging an electric toothbrush or shaver since they would have to hang from their cords. Outlets were not conveniently located or abundant. We ended up plugging a laptop in the one available outlet behind the desk and the Blackberry in one behind the TV and alternating with everything else that needed to be charged. The AC was very noisy and would keep a light sleeper awake unless the person had been driving around half the night looking for the hotel. The best part about our hotel stay was the Veranda, which offered good sandwiches and local beer and the main restaurant, which offered nice buffetâ€™s on some nights. The service was great in both areas. The relatively new lazy river type pool was interesting too and wifi was available there as well. You must have a colored bracelet from the front desk to enter the pool area, but thereâ€™s no additional charge other then the $9.00 resort fee you have to pay on top of the room anyway. If you want a tube to float on though, itâ€™ll cost you $5.35. All in all, the hotel met our basic needs, but if I returned to Mayaguez, Iâ€™d consider investigating Rincon as an alternative base.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go unless they update the premises.”
Reviews.Author: mkdinny
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s start with the pros because the pros may outweigh the cons for some but for this traveler, the cons are reason enough to stay away! Pros: The new pool is absolutely beautiful. If the attention and detail that was paid to the pool area was translated to the rest of the â€œresort,â€� this review would be glowing. The Veranda bar area is also beautiful and makes you feel like you are in a tropical locale. The â€œresortâ€� also offers free buffet-style breakfast in the on-premises restaurant. The food is absolutely delicious! Do not miss out on the oatmeal which is superior to any other (and I am not even an oatmeal fan) or the white cheese, guava paste and wide assortment of tropical fruits. The breakfast buffet is a great lead-in into the cons. Cons: Our first day at breakfast was August 3, 2009. The maÃ®tre de who seated us was very polite. However, we had a younger, tall gentleman who was going around the room serving coffee. First, trying to get his attention was impossible. Second, when he did come to serve coffee and we asked for separate milk, not realizing that it was Spanish coffee that required hot milk to be poured in by him, he stormed off and literally almost threw the cold mike on the table. From the beginning he never uttered â€œhelloâ€� or â€œyouâ€™re welcomeâ€� after we repeatedly said â€œthank you.â€� It became a game to us to say â€œthank youâ€� and wait for his response. On the second day he â€œturnedâ€� nice when he was given a tip which was only given to solicit a response from the otherwise stone-faced waiter. Notably, he was very friendly to Puerto Ricans who were speaking Spanish, which I speak and understand. Thankfully, it must have been his days off for the remainder of our four-day stay. Unfortunately, this waiter was only continuing the not-so-friendly behavior of those at the front desk. I am not certain what the criteria for a resort is but this is just a hotel with a pool, restaurant and casino. The front-desk staff, depending on who was there always had a different answer to the question â€œDo I need to keep the wrist-band on?â€� They will tag you with a neon colored wrist band for entrance to the pool when you check in or does it have to be on at all times? Who knows, they each have a different answer. We did not want to tour the island with the neon colored band. This is not a Disney resort. Everyone was very nasty. Even when you went to the front desk to have it removed, they did not keep track of it or write down what room you were staying in. However, youâ€™ll want to stay in the reception desk area because the hallways, including the veranda are open air in the sweltering heat and youâ€™ll sweat to death by the time you get to your car! The west needs to head to San Juan and take some lessons in customer service. To top it off, the rooms need to be updated. Were they expecting little people? The height of the sinks in the bathrooms are abnormally low. Our room was never vacuumed the entire time. To top it off, we saw and killed a roach in the bathroom! These rooms need a makeover. While theyâ€™re at it, hire a contractor who doesnâ€™t paint on the mirror in the bathroom. Whoever painted last was super sloppy. In sum, if this is the best that the west has to offer, the west is in big trouble!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: logannagaubo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Mayaguez resort in the past, this time around was really impressed by the out come of the new pool with its water falls and a touch of that disney land magic added in. The breakfast buffet was very good as they offered a variety of foods and fruits to choose from. We stayed there three nights and wished we had booked a few more nights, the Casino is huge and alive compared to other casinos on the island. Mr Irrizarry the manager at the Castillo restuarant is a true gentelman and made us feel at home every morning at breakfast. The Gereral Manager Mr. Louis MuÃ±oz has also made us feel at home, I thank him and his staff for a great stay...

Reviews.Title: “worst place on the island unless you only pay 65 a night”
Reviews.Author: g2b_raven
Reviews.Content: not the best in the west as they say! paid lots of cash for a bestwestern. say some where close to the beach you will thank me. i was down there for some time. this is not a real resort the room are small no view. the motel just dosnt have much to offer. The casino is very small and a million old ladys come in on the weekends to play. not that I have a problem with old ladys. i just dont need to a pushing contest to see who gets the slot or not.

Reviews.Title: “Mayaguez Resort a Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Voyageking
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before, but now was a much more spectacular time. Even though the main attraction is the casino, the restaurant was excellent with international and caribbean fares. The wine list was exceptional an has won the "Award of Excellence" from The Wine Spectator eight years ina row. The service, was excellent. The Veranda Terrace Bar was a nice place to enjoy a cocktail and a cigar that is made by the owner of the hotel. I will definately stay here again. I felt comfortable and everybody made me feel that I was at home. My home in Mayaguez and Puerto Rico is the Mayaguez Resort & Casino. As for the rooms, they invested over a million (they told me) and it really shows. New bed heads, conforters, shades, furniture and refrigerators. The Room Srvice operates until 3 am. They have wireless internet and altogether the ambiance is very nice. I will always stay here in what the locals call Porta del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Select a different place.”
Reviews.Author: 1putt
Reviews.Content: The rooms were drab & uninviting; a long way from "luxury." Prices quoted for accommodations changed with each different individual at the front desk. Food & drinks were overpriced. Lots of hidden fees. Not a place I'd ever return!

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. If you're in the area, you're only choices are this and the Hoilday Inn. Will try the Holiday Inn next time. For the money, this room stunk.

Reviews.Title: “High priced for what was offered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It seems a stretch to call this a resort. It did have a couple tennis courts and a small weight room (located a long outdoor walk from the rooms). The pool was not used much by other guests, so we had it almost to ourselves. It was rectangular, with good variation in depth from the shallow to deep end. The restaurant had excellent food, but they wouldn't allow any shorts. Other resorts we have stayed at always allow nice shorts, some restrict cutoffs. They had no business center to check email. The casino was nice, lots of nickel machines, so many elderly locals were there. Staff was very friendly. The place seemed really overpriced considering the few amenities.
